error.signature: ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement (from versions: none). No matching distribution found
error.regex: invalid.*index|Could not find.*versions: none|Looking in indexes.*failed|No matching distribution.*index

verdict.summary: The configured package index URL is invalid, unreachable, or does not contain the requested package. Often caused by typo in --index-url, wrong pip.conf, or private index that requires authentication.

dead_ends.action: Keep retrying with the same index URL
dead_ends.why_fails: If the URL is wrong or the index does not carry the package, retrying will never work
Disables all indexes without providing an alternative source; pip cannot find any packages

workarounds.action: Verify and fix the index URL: pip install --index-url https://pypi.org/simple/ <package>
workarounds.how: Check pip config list for index-url, fix typos, and ensure the URL ends with /simple/

workarounds.action: Use --extra-index-url to add PyPI as fallback alongside private index
workarounds.condition: when using private index that lacks some packages

workarounds.action: Configure authentication for private index using keyring or netrc
workarounds.how: pip install keyring && pip config set global.index-url https://user:token@private.index/simple/

leads_to.condition: when custom index uses self-signed certificates

preceded_by.condition: when proxy blocks access to the package index

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Index-url-invalid means the entire index is misconfigured; no-matching-distribution means the index works but the specific package/version is not available
